subject: Re: Unit testing a method that contains objects
msgSnippet: First of all, I would like to thank you everyone for taking their time to help me started in the right direction. I have thought of a few solutions suggested
messageBody:
First of all, I would like to thank you everyone for taking their time
to help me started in the right direction.

I have thought of a few solutions suggested by everyone i.e. Spring
IoC and Joe's approach.

But, I could not decide which one is better and don't know what is the
better approach out there.

I think I am going with Joe's suggestion below since it is the
simplest until I found out a better way. It is always a challenge to
work on a legacy.

Again, thank you for the valuable suggestions and resources
recommended by everyone.

Best regard,
Lee

> // Backwards compatible with the old version, probably remains
untested
> public Object fetchSomething() {
> return fetchSomething(new SomeClass());
> }
>
> // New version that you test
> public Object fetchSomething(SomeClass someClass) {
> ....
> }
>
> The "old version" is not tested directly, but it's so small that
it's
> not likely to break.
